item.description:
Gifford Pinchot Living History Presentation

Wednesday, May 18, 2011

6:30 p.m.

Admission is FREE

Gifford Pinchot was America’s first forester and the first Chief of the United States Forest Service. Gary Hines will portray Pinchot in this multi-media living history program. This event is part of New Hampshire’s observation of the 100th Anniversary of the Weeks Act which authorized the creation of the White Mountain National Forest. Pinchot, as presented by Hines, will describe the beginning of the American conservation movement as he lived it.  Pinchot used his family connections, as well as his imagination and love of the outdoors, to shape and direct the beginnings of the nation’s environmental movement. Hines wrote the script for this presentation and has performed it in many venues around the nation. He is the author of several books for children. This program is presented by the New Hampshire Timberland Owners Association and funded by the New Hampshire Humanities Council.
item.name: Gifford Pinchot Living History Presentation
